Articles.Content:
Ok, so I recently tried out the fith version of B9 (the full release version). It was installed on a clean copy of ksp 0.24 (32 bit). I also installed Mechjeb 2 and Active texture reduction (Stable Aggressive). After a lengthy startup (so active texture reduction definately worked) the game seemed to be working fine. I created a new save and headed over to the hanger to build a spaceplane. Then the problem arose. As you probably know, B9 5 reduced the amount of parts by letting you switch between different versions. However, every single switchable part was bugged. The parts had all of the varients loaded at the same time and the textures were bugging out like when two parts clip. In addition, I could not switch between the part varients either-the option simply wasn't there apon right clicking.

Does anybody have any idea what I could do to fix this, or what is wrong?

EDIT: Using the wrong version of ksp-I wasn't quite up to date enough. Should be fixed now, you can delete the thread.

Edited September 4, 2014 by randomness5555
Please follow the guide in the READ FIRST sticky. Sounds like an error with fFirespitter.
Firespitter is definately installed right and was the version that came with B9. However I'll update it to latest and see if that helps.

Do you have the full version of TweakScale installed? There is a confirmed incompatibility between Firespriter's multipart sistem and Tweakscale that causes the bug you describe. If you do have Tweakscale, you can remove the B9 configuration file on it's folder and that should fix the bug.

Hope this helps

Ahh...That could explain it. I think I might have that installed. I'll give that a try-see what happens.

IMPORTAND EDIT: Sorry guys, I goofed X| I was still running ksp 0.24-whereas it says you need 0.24.2+. My bad.

Edited September 4, 2014 by randomness5555
